extension.dc:title: Darwin Core Event
extension.name: Event
extension.dc:description: The category of information pertaining to a sampling event. Updated March 2014 with newly ratified terms (parentEventID, sampleSizeValue, sampleSizeUnit).

property.name: type
property.dc:description: The nature or genre of the resource. For Darwin Core, recommended best practice is to use the name of the class that defines the root of the record.

property.name: modified
property.dc:description: The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed. For Darwin Core, recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E)
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC, "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC, "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809, "1906-06" is Jun 1906, "1971" is just that year, "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC, "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007

property.name: language
property.dc:description: A language of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 [RFC4646]

property.name: rights
property.dc:description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights
property.examples: "Content licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 United States License"

property.name: rightsHolder
property.dc:description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource
property.examples: "The Regents of the University of California."

property.name: accessRights
property.dc:description: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies

property.name: bibliographicCitation
property.dc:description: A bibliographic reference for the resource as a statement indicating how this record should be cited (attributed) when used. Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible
property.examples: "Ctenomys sociabilis (MVZ 165861)" for a specimen, "Oliver P. Pearson. 1985. Los tuco-tucos (genera Ctenomys) de los Parques Nacionales Lanin y Nahuel Huapi, Argentina Historia Natural, 5(37):337-343." for a Taxon

property.name: references
property.dc:description: A URL to a related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource. Often another webpage showing the same, but richer resource

property.name: datasetID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

property.name: datasetName
property.dc:description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

property.name: institutionID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

property.name: ownerInstitutionCode
property.dc:description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

property.name: informationWithheld
property.dc:description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.
property.examples: "location information not given for endangered species", "collector identities withheld", "ask about tissue samples"

property.name: dataGeneralizations
property.dc:description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
property.examples: "Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell"

property.name: dynamicProperties
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record. Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content such as key-value pairs.
property.examples: "tragusLengthInMeters=0.014; weightInGrams=120", "heightInMeters=1.5", "natureOfID=expert identification; identificationEvidence=cytochrome B sequence", "relativeHumidity=28; airTemperatureInC=22; sampleSizeInKilograms=10", "aspectHeading=277; slopeInDegrees=6", "iucnStatus=vulnerable; taxonDistribution=Neuquen, Argentina"

property.name: eventID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: parentEventID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.
property.examples: May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. Example: "A1" as parentEventID to identify the main Whittaker Plot in nested samples, each with its own eventID (e.g., "A1:1", "A1:2"). For discussion see http://terms.tdwg.org/wiki/dwc:parentEventID

property.name: samplingProtocol
property.dc:description: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.
property.examples: "UV light trap", "mist net", "bottom trawl", "ad hoc observation", "point count", "Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x", "Takats et al. 2001. Guidelines for Nocturnal Owl Monitoring in North America. Beaverhill Bird Observatory and Bird Studies Canada, Edmonton, Alberta. 32 pp.", "http://www.bsc-eoc.org/download/Owl.pdf"

property.name: samplingEffort
property.dc:description: The amount of effort expended during an Event.
property.examples: "40 trap-nights", "10 observer-hours; 10 km by foot; 30 km by car"

property.name: eventDate
property.dc:description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC, "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC, "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809, "1906-06" is Jun 1906, "1971" is just that year, "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC, "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.

property.name: eventTime
property.dc:description: The time or interval during which an Event occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).
property.examples: "14:07-0600" is 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC, "08:40:21Z" is 8:40:21am UTC, "13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1pm UTC and 3:30pm UTC.

property.name: startDayOfYear
property.dc:description: The earliest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
property.examples: "1" (=1 Jan), "366" (=31 Dec), "365" (=30 Dec in a leap year, 31 Dec in a non-leap year)

property.name: endDayOfYear
property.dc:description: The latest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
property.examples: "1" (=1 Jan), "366" (=31 Dec), "365" (=30 Dec in a leap year, 31 Dec in a non-leap year)

property.name: year
property.dc:description: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

property.name: month
property.dc:description: The ordinal month in which the Event occurred.

property.name: day
property.dc:description: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

property.name: verbatimEventDate
property.dc:description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

property.name: habitat
property.dc:description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

property.name: fieldNumber
property.dc:description: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

property.name: fieldNotes
property.dc:description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

property.name: eventRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the Event.
property.examples: "after the recent rains the river is nearly at flood stage"

property.name: sampleSizeValue
property.dc:description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.
property.examples: A sampleSizeValue must have a corresponding sampleSizeUnit. Example: "5" for sampleSizeValue with "metre" for sampleSizeUnit. For discussion see http://terms.tdwg.org/wiki/dwc:sampleSizeValue

property.name: sampleSizeUnit
property.dc:description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.
property.examples: A sampleSizeUnit must have a corresponding sampleSizeValue, e.g., "5" for sampleSizeValue with "metre" for sampleSizeUnit. Examples: "minute", "hour", "day", "metre", "square metre", "cubic metre". Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Ontology of Units of Measure http://www.wurvoc.org/vocabularies/om-1.8/ of SI units, derived units, or other non-SI units accepted for use within the SI (e.g., minute, hour, day, litre). For discussion see http://terms.tdwg.org/wiki/dwc:sampleSizeUnit

property.name: locationID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: higherGeographyID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the Location occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an persistent identifier from a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.
property.examples: "TGN: 1002002" for Prov. Tierra del Fuego, Argentina

property.name: higherGeography
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the locality term.
property.examples: "South America; Argentina; Patagonia; Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi; Neuquén; Los Lagos" with accompanying values "South America" in Continent, "Argentina" in Country, "Neuquén" in StateProvince, and Los Lagos in County.

property.name: continent
property.dc:description: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names or the ISO 3166 Continent code.

property.name: waterBody
property.dc:description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

property.name: islandGroup
property.dc:description: The name of the island group in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

property.name: island
property.dc:description: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

property.name: country
property.dc:description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

property.name: countryCode
property.dc:description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes.

property.name: stateProvince
property.dc:description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

property.name: county
property.dc:description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

property.name: municipality
property.dc:description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.

property.name: locality
property.dc:description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

property.name: verbatimLocality
property.dc:description: The original textual description of the place.
property.examples: "25 km NNE Bariloche por R. Nac. 237"

property.name: verbatimElevation
property.dc:description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

property.name: minimumElevationInMeters
property.dc:description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

property.name: maximumElevationInMeters
property.dc:description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

property.name: verbatimDepth
property.dc:description: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

property.name: minimumDepthInMeters
property.dc:description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

property.name: maximumDepthInMeters
property.dc:description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

property.name: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
property.dc:description: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
property.examples: 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation; VerbatimElevation: "300m" MinimumElevationInMeters: "300", MaximumElevationInMeters: "300", VerbatimDepth: "20m", MinimumDepthInMeters: "20", MaximumDepthInMeters: "20", minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: "0", maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: "-1.5"

property.name: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
property.dc:description: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
property.examples: 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation; VerbatimElevation: "300m" MinimumElevationInMeters: "300", MaximumElevationInMeters: "300", VerbatimDepth: "20m", MinimumDepthInMeters: "20", MaximumDepthInMeters: "20", minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: "0", maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: "-1.5"

property.name: locationAccordingTo
property.dc:description: Information about the source of this Location information. Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution, or team of individuals.

property.name: locationRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the Location.

property.name: verbatimCoordinates
property.dc:description: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

property.name: verbatimLatitude
property.dc:description: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

property.name: verbatimLongitude
property.dc:description: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

property.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
property.dc:description: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: verbatimSRS
property.dc:description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or verbatimCoordinates are based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value "unknown".

property.name: decimalLatitude
property.dc:description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

property.name: decimalLongitude
property.dc:description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

property.name: geodeticDatum
property.dc:description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value "unknown".

property.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
property.dc:description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.
property.examples: "30" (reasonable lower limit of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time), "71" (uncertainty for a UTM coordinate having 100 meter precision and a known spatial reference system).

property.name: coordinatePrecision
property.dc:description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.
property.examples: "0.00001" (normal GPS limit for decimal degrees), "0.000278" (nearest second), "0.01667" (nearest minute), "1.0" (nearest degree)

property.name: pointRadiusSpatialFit
property.dc:description: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left blank) if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1.
property.examples: Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the "Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing", Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006 (http://www.gbif.org/prog/digit/Georeferencing).

property.name: footprintWKT
property.dc:description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the Location. A Location may have both a point-radius representation (see decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.
property.examples: the one-degree bounding box with opposite corners at (longitude=10, latitude=20) and (longitude=11, latitude=21) would be expressed in well-known text as POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))

property.name: footprintSRS
property.dc:description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the Spatial Reference System (SRS) for the footprintWKT of the Location. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude, even if it is the same as for the footprintWKT - use the geodeticDatum instead.
property.examples: The WKT for the standard WGS84 SRS (EPSG:4326) is "GEOGCS["GCS_WGS_1984",DATUM["D_WGS_1984",SPHEROID["WGS_1984",6378137,298.257223563]],PRIMEM["Greenwich",0],UNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]]" without the enclosing quotes.

property.name: footprintSpatialFit
property.dc:description: The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. The footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left blank) if the original representation is a point and the given georeference is not that same point. If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the footprintSpatialFit is 1.
property.examples: Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the "Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing", Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006 (http://www.gbif.org/prog/digit/Georeferencing).

property.name: georeferencedBy
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) the Location.

property.name: georeferencedDate
property.dc:description: The date on which the Location was georeferenced. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

property.name: georeferenceProtocol
property.dc:description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.
property.examples: "Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing" (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006), Global Biodiversity Information Facility.", "MaNIS/HerpNet/ORNIS Georeferencing Guidelines", "BioGeomancer"

property.name: georeferenceSources
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.
property.examples: "USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad; Terrametrics 2008 on Google Earth"

property.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
property.dc:description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: georeferenceRemarks
property.dc:description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

property.name: geologicalContextID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of information associated with a GeologicalContext (the location within a geological context, such as stratigraphy). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: earliestEonOrLowestEonothem
property.dc:description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: latestEonOrHighestEonothem
property.dc:description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: earliestEraOrLowestErathem
property.dc:description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: latestEraOrHighestErathem
property.dc:description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem
property.dc:description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: latestPeriodOrHighestSystem
property.dc:description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: earliestEpochOrLowestSeries
property.dc:description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: latestEpochOrHighestSeries
property.dc:description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: earliestAgeOrLowestStage
property.dc:description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: latestAgeOrHighestStage
property.dc:description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: lowestBiostratigraphicZone
property.dc:description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: highestBiostratigraphicZone
property.dc:description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: lithostratigraphicTerms
property.dc:description: The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for the rock from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: group
property.dc:description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: formation
property.dc:description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: member
property.dc:description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the cataloged item was collected.

property.name: bed
property.dc:description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the cataloged item was collected.
